member.name: T:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTriggerModifier
member.summary: Configures the device to automatically complete an acquisition if a trigger has not been received, after a period of time.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTriggerModifier.None
member.summary: The acquisition is not triggered if the trigger is set to any value other than .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTriggerModifier.Auto
member.summary: The acquisition is auto-triggered, if no trigger arrives.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTriggerSlope
member.summary: Specifies whether a rising or a falling edge triggers the digitizer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTriggerSlope.Positive
member.summary: A positive (rising) edge passing through the trigger level triggers the digitizer. For a digital trigger, this corresponds to a low-to-high transition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTriggerSlope.Negative
member.summary: A negative (falling) edge passing through the trigger level triggers the digitizer. For a digital trigger, this corresponds to a high-to-low transition.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition
member.summary: Gets and sets the record to fetch from a channel that you specify.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.SampleMode
member.summary: Gets the the digitizer is currently using.
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.BinarySampleWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the bit width of the binary data in the acquired waveform, which is useful for determining which binary fetch method to use.
member.value: The default value of this property is device-dependent. Valid values are 8, 16, and 32.
member.remarks: To configure the device to store samples with a lower resolution than the native resolution, set this property to the desired binary width. This process can be useful for streaming at faster speeds at the cost of the resolution. The least significant bits are lost with this configuration.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.Resolution
member.summary: Gets the bit width of valid data (as opposed to padding bits) in the acquired waveform.
member.value: The bit width of valid data in the acquired waveform.
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.RecordNumberToFetch
member.summary: Gets or sets the record to fetch from a channel you specify.
member.value: The default value is 0. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.NumberOfRecordsToFetch
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of records to fetch.
member.remarks: If you want to fetch all records from the record you specify in to the last record configured, use -1.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.Backlog
member.summary: Gets the number of () samples that have been acquired but not fetched for the record specified by .
member.value: The number of samples that have been acquired but not fetched for the record specified by record number to fetch.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.NumberOfMeasurementSamplesToFetch
member.summary: Specifies the number of samples to fetch when performing a measurement. Use -1 to fetch the actual record length.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.DataTransferBlockSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of samples to transfer at one time from the device to host memory.
member.value: Maximum number of samples to transfer at one time from the device to host memory.
member.remarks: Increasing this number should result in better fetching performance because the driver does not need to restart the transfers as often. However, increasing this number may also increase the amount of page-locked memory required from the system.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.OverflowErrorReportingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the reporting mode when the onboard signal processing block detects an overflow in any of its stages. Overflows lead to clipping of the waveform.
member.value: Specifies the . The default value is .
member.remarks: You can access this property only with high-speed digitizers that support onboard signal processing (OSP), such as the NI PXI-5142. If you open a session with a device that does not support OSP and you attempt to access this property, a is thrown.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.DdcDataProcessingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the way in which data is processed by the digital downconverter (DDC).
member.remarks: You can access this property only with high-speed digitizers that support onboard signal processing (OSP), such as the NI 5142. If you open a session with a device that does not support OSP and you attempt to access this property, a is thrown.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.DataTransferBandwidthMax
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum bandwidth that the device is allowed to consume.
member.value: The maximum bandwidth on the PCIe bus that is used during data transfer.
member.remarks: The NI device limits itself to transfer fewer bytes per second on the PCIe bus than the value you specify for this property.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.DataTransferPacketSizePreferred
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred size of the data field in the PCI Express (PCIe) packet during data transfer.
member.value: This property must be a power of two (64, 128,... , 512).
member.remarks: In general, the larger the packet size, the more efficiently the device uses the bus. However, some systems, because of their implementation, perform better with smaller packet sizes.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.SampleRate
member.summary: Gets the effective sample rate using the current configuration in samples per second.
member.value: The effective sample rate using the current configuration in samples per second.
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.SampleRateMin
member.summary: Gets or sets the sampling rate for the acquisition in samples per second.
member.value: The combination of this property and must allow the digitizer to sample at a valid sampling rate and not require more memory than the onboard memory module allows.
member.remarks: This property is the frequency at which digitized samples are stored, expressed in samples per second. This property is rounded up to the next valid sampling rate that the device supports. If is set to , the sampling rate must be set lower than the of the digitizer, so data can be digitized at the requested rate. If is set to , sampling rates can be set higher than the maximum real-time sampling rate of the digitizer. When this happens, NI-SCOPE enters random interleaved sampling (RIS) mode, where it acquires multiple waveforms at the maximum real-time sampling rate and reconstructs a periodic waveform.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.NumberOfPointsMin
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of points you require in the waveform record for each channel. NI-SCOPE uses the value you specify to configure the record length that the digitizer uses for waveform acquisition. returns the actual record length.
member.value: Valid values range from 1 to the available onboard memory.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.RecordLength
member.summary: Gets the actual number of points the digitizer acquires for each channel.
member.value: The value is equal to or greater than the minimum number of points you specify with .
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.StartTime
member.summary: Specifies the length of time, in seconds, from the trigger event to the first point in the waveform record.
member.value: Length of time from the trigger event to the first point in the waveform record in seconds.
member.remarks: If the value is positive, the first point in the waveform record occurs after the trigger event. If the value is negative, the first point in the waveform record occurs before the trigger event.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeAcquisition.TimePerRecord
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time that corresponds to the record length.
member.value: The length of time that corresponds to the record length.

member.summary: Gets the sub-object.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeReferenceTrigger.Delay
member.summary: Gets or sets the trigger delay time, in seconds. The trigger delay time is the length of time the digitizer waits after receiving the trigger. The event that occurs when the trigger delay elapses is the Reference Event.
member.value: Valid values for this property are instrument-dependent, and range from 0.0 seconds to 171.8 seconds.
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeReferenceTrigger.ReferencePosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the Reference Event in the waveform record. When the digitizer detects a trigger, it waits the length of time specified by . The event that occurs when the delay time elapses is the Reference Event. The Reference Event is relative to the start of the record and is a percentage of the record length. For example, the value 50.0 corresponds to the center of the waveform record and 0.0 corresponds to the first element in the waveform record.
member.value: The valid values for this property range from 0.0 to 100.0.
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeReferenceTrigger.QuietTimeMin
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time the trigger circuit must not detect a signal above the trigger level, or below the trigger level if the trigger slope is negative, before the trigger is armed.
member.value: Any value greater than equal to 0.
member.remarks:
Before setting this property to any positive value, complete the following steps:
Set the trigger to trigger type.
Set the DDC to true on channel 0.
Set the to
Set the reference trigger to .
Set the reference trigger to channel "0."
You can access this property only with high-speed digitizers that support onboard signal processing (OSP), such as the NI 5142. If you open a session with an instrument that does not support OSP and you attempt to access this property, a is thrown.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeReferenceTrigger.DetectorLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets which reference trigger detection circuitry to use on the instrument.
member.value: Specifies the . The default value is .
member.remarks: You can access this property only with high-speed digitizers that support onboard signal processing (OSP), such as the NI 5142. If you open a session with an instrument that does not support OSP and you attempt to access this property, a is thrown.

member.summary: Sends the Reference Trigger to the digitizer. Call this method if has been configured to SoftwareTriggerFunction.
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeReferenceTrigger.Hysteresis
member.summary: Specifies the size of the hysteresis window on either side of the trigger level.
member.value:
Units: Volts
Min Value: 0
Max Value for positive trigger slope:Hysteresis - trigger level >= -(vertical range/2) + vertical offset
Max Value for negative trigger slope:Hysteresis + trigger level <= -(vertical range/2) + vertical offset

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeRisMethod
member.summary: Specifies the algorithm for random-interleaved sampling, which is used if the sample rate exceeds the maximum sampling rate.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeRisMethod.ExactNumberOfAverages
member.summary: Acquires the specified number of records for each bin in the RIS acquisition.
member.remarks: The fetch method throws an exception if the RIS acquisition does not successfully acquire the specified number of waveforms within the timeout period. You can call fetch again to allow more time for the acquisition to finish.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeRisMethod.MinimumNumberOfAverages
member.summary: Averages each RIS sample of at least minimum number average randomly distributed points. Any extra points taken are also averaged in.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeRisMethod.Incomplete
member.summary: Returns the RIS waveform after the specified timeout even if it is incomplete.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeRisMethod.LimitedBinWidth
member.summary: Limits the waveforms in the various bins to be within 200 ps of the center of the bin.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTiming.ConfigureTiming(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configures the common properties of the horizontal subsystem for a multirecord acquisition in terms of minimum sample rate.
member.param: The sampling rate for the acquisition.
The minimum number of points you need in the record for each channel
The position of the reference event in the waveform record specified as a percentage.
The number of records to acquire.

Indicates whether the digitizer enforces real-time measurements or allows equivalent-time (RIS) measurements. Not all digitizers support RIS. Refer to Features Supported by Device for more information.

member.summary: Configures the properties for synchronizing the digitizer to a reference or sending the digitizer's reference clock output to be used as a synchronizing clock for other digitizers.
member.param: The input source for the reference clock to which the 100 MHz sample clock is phase-locked.
The output source for the reference clock to which another scope's sample clock can be phased-locked.

For the NI 5102, specifies the line on which the sample clock is sent or received. For the NI 5112/5620/5621/5911, specifies the line on which the one time sync pulse is sent or received. This line should be the same for all instruments to be synchronized.

Specifies whether you want the instrument to be a master or a slave. The master instrument is typically the originator of the trigger signal and clock sync pulse. For a standalone instrument, set this property to VI_FALSE.
member.remarks: Some features are not supported by all digitizers. Refer to Features Supported by Device for more information.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTiming.MoreRecordsThanMemoryAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether more records can be configured with than fit in the onboard memory.
member.remarks: If this property is set to , it is necessary to fetch records while the acquisition is in progress. Eventually, some of the records will be overwritten. The fetch method throws an exception if you attempt to fetch a record after it has been overwritten.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTiming.ReferenceClockRate

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTiming.ReferenceClockSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the input source for the PLL reference clock to which the digitizer will be phase-locked; for the NI 5102, this is the source of the board clock.
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API
member.remarks: The input source for the PLL reference clock is 1 MHz to 20 MHz clock on SMC-based digitizers and the 10 MHz clock for the NI 5112/5620/5621/5911

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTiming.RisAverages
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of averages for each bin in an RIS acquisition.
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API
member.remarks: The number of averages times the oversampling factor is the minimum number of real-time acquisitions necessary to reconstruct the RIS waveform. Averaging is useful in RIS because the trigger times are not evenly spaced, so adjacent points in the reconstructed waveform cannot be accurately spaced. With averaging, the errors in both time and voltage are smoothed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ratio between the and the (which can be slower) if is an external source.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTiming.SampleClockTimebaseMultiplier
member.summary: If is an external source, this attribute specifies the ratio between the and the , which can be higher. This property can be used in conjunction with the attribute. Some instruments use multiple ADCs to sample the same channel at an effective sample rate that is greater than the specified clock rate. When providing an external sample clock use this property to indicate when you want a higher sample rate. Valid values for this attribute vary by instrument and current configuration.
member.value: If is an external source, this attribute specifies the ratio between the and the actual sample rate, which can be higher.
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTiming.AdjustSampleClockRelativeDelay(NationalInstruments.PrecisionTimeSpan)
member.summary: Configures the relative sample clock delay in seconds when using the internal clock. Each time this method is called, the sample clock is delayed by the specified amount of time.
member.param: The amount of time, in seconds, to delay the sample clock. This is a relative value, so repeated calls to this method delays the sample clock by this amount every time.
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTiming.FractionalResample
member.summary: Gets the sub-object that you use to configure fractional resampling on the high speed digitizer.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeTiming.AbsoluteSampleClockOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the absolute time offset of the sample clock relative to the reference clock.
member.remarks: Configures the sample clock relationship with respect to the reference clock. This parameter is factored into NI-TClk adjustments and is typically used to improve the repeatability of NI-TClk Synchronization. When this parameter is read, the currently programmed value is returned. The range of the absolute sample clock offset is [-0.5 sample clock periods, 0.5 sample clock periods]. The default absolute sample clock offset is 0 s.
member.value: The absolute time offset of the sample clock relative to the reference clock.
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API
member.exception: was accessed after associated or object was disposed.
The underlying NI-SCOPE driver returned an error.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeWindowReferenceTrigger
member.summary: Represents sub-objects of that contain properties related to the window reference trigger.
member.remarks: For more information, refer to the Trigger Window attributes topics in the NI-SCOPE Function Reference Help.
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeWindowReferenceTrigger.LowLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower voltage threshold you want the digitizer to use for window triggering.
member.value:
The values for this property must meet the following conditions:
Low Trigger Level <= Vertical Range/2 + Vertical Offset
Low Trigger Level >= (-Vertical Range/2) + Vertical Offset
Low Trigger Level < High Trigger Level
member.remarks: The digitizer triggers when the trigger signal enters or leaves the window specified with this property and .
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeWindowReferenceTrigger.HighLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper voltage threshold you want the digitizer to use for window triggering.
member.value:
The values for this property must meet the following conditions:
High Trigger Level <= Vertical Range/2 + Vertical Offset
High Trigger Level >= (-Vertical Range/2) + Vertical Offset
High Trigger Level > Low Trigger Level
member.remarks: The digitizer triggers when the trigger signal enters or leaves the window specified with and this property.
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.ModularInstruments.NIScope.ScopeWindowReferenceTrigger.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a trigger must occur when the signal enters or leaves the window as specified by or .
member.seealso: Mapping the NI-SCOPE .NET API to the NI-SCOPE C API
